Package org.neo4j.kernel.impl.store.format

Class BaseOneByteHeaderRecordFormat<RECORD extends AbstractBaseRecord>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.neo4j.kernel.impl.store.format.BaseRecordFormat<RECORD>
      • org.neo4j.kernel.impl.store.format.BaseOneByteHeaderRecordFormat<RECORD>
  • Type Parameters:
    RECORD - type of record.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    RecordFormat<RECORD>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    DynamicRecordFormat, MetaDataRecordFormat, NodeRecordFormat, RelationshipGroupRecordFormat, RelationshipRecordFormat, SchemaRecordFormat, TokenRecordFormat
    public abstract class BaseOneByteHeaderRecordFormat<RECORD extends AbstractBaseRecord>
extends BaseRecordFormat<RECORD>
    Implementation of a very common type of format where the first byte, at least one bit in it, say whether or not the record is in use. That can be used to let sub classes have simpler read/write implementations. The rest of the 7 bits in that header byte are free to use by subclasses.

    • Method Detail

      • markAsUnused

        protected void markAsUnused​(PageCursor cursor)

      • isInUse

        public boolean isInUse​(PageCursor cursor)
        Description copied from interface: RecordFormat
        Quickly determines whether or not record starting right at where the cursor is placed is in use or not.
        Parameters:
        cursor - PageCursor to read data from, placed at the start of record to determine in use status of.
        Returns:
        whether or not the record at where the cursor is placed is in use.

      • isInUse

        protected boolean isInUse​(byte headerByte)
        Given a record with a header byte this method checks the specific bit which this record format was configured to interpret as inUse.
        Parameters:
        headerByte - header byte of a record (the first byte) which contains the inUse bit we're interested in.
        Returns:
        whether or not this header byte has the specific bit saying that it's in use.

      • has

        protected static boolean has​(long headerByte,
                             int bitMask)
        Checks whether or not a specific bit in a byte is set.
        Parameters:
        headerByte - the header byte to check, here represented as a long for convenience due to many callers keeping this header as long as to remove common problems of forgetting to cast to long before shifting.
        bitMask - mask for the bit to check, such as 0x1, 0x2 and 0x4.
        Returns:
        whether or not that bit is set.

      • set

        protected static byte set​(byte headerByte,
                          int bitMask,
                          boolean value)
        Sets or clears bits specified by the bitMask in the header byte.
        Parameters:
        headerByte - byte to set bits in.
        bitMask - mask specifying which bits to change.
        value - true means setting the bits specified by the bit mask, false means clearing.
        Returns:
        the headerByte with the changes incorporated.
